plants.name: Mango
plants.medicinalBenefits: Mango leaves are used in traditional medicine for various purposes. They are believed to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
plants.facts: Mango is a tropical fruit known for its sweet taste and juicy flesh.
plants.whereToObtain: Mango trees are commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions. Fruits can be obtained from local markets.

plants.name: Betel
plants.medicinalBenefits: Betel leaves are often chewed for their stimulant properties. They are also used in traditional medicine for various health benefits.
plants.facts: Betel is a vine belonging to the Piperaceae family, and its leaves are commonly chewed with areca nut and slaked lime.
plants.whereToObtain: Betel leaves are available in local markets and can be grown in home gardens.

plants.name: Tulsi
plants.medicinalBenefits: Tulsi, or holy basil, is considered sacred in Ayurveda. It is known for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
plants.facts: Tulsi is an aromatic herb with green leaves and a strong, pleasant aroma.
plants.whereToObtain: Tulsi plants can be grown at home, and leaves are also available in herbal stores.

cons: May cause allergic reactions in some individuals

plants.name: Mint
plants.medicinalBenefits: Mint leaves are known for their refreshing flavor and various health benefits. They are often used in teas and culinary dishes.
plants.facts: Mint is a fragrant herb with green leaves and a cooling taste.
plants.whereToObtain: Mint is commonly available in grocery stores and can be grown in home gardens.

cons: May be invasive when grown in gardens

plants.name: Curry Leaf
plants.medicinalBenefits: Curry leaves are rich in antioxidants and are believed to have various health benefits. They are commonly used in Indian cuisine.
plants.facts: Curry leaf is a small, aromatic leaf often used to add flavor to dishes.
plants.whereToObtain: Curry leaf plants can be grown at home, and fresh leaves are available in grocery stores.
